Knockups were **specifically** designed to counter tenacity, because it was good at the time in preventing and limiting a lot of standard CC. But that's fine, because other boot choices like Mobis and company were actually viable, and they cost more, so it was a real opportunity cost to doing so. The reason knockups were created and introduced like they were was to accentuate a CC-orientated champion's kit in such a way so that their CRITICAL contribution would not be negated by tenacity. Alistar for example, prior to his WQ combo being mainstream, pretty much just Q'd in the teamfight at a relatively low cooldown. His entire contribution was his Q, so it had a knockup so that he wasn't useless.

Malphite, similarly, had his ult be a knockup so it's not useless.

But now everyone and their mother has displacements that cannot be reduced via tenacity. Even if you QSS the "stun" you still can't move while being knocked up, you can only flash. Now, not only is tenacity basically useless because every champion whose given a 1s or more CC has a knockup that isn't reduced via tenacity, other boot options are garbage, so we're forced to go to the only decent options left.

Tabis aren't crazy strong, they're just the only decent boots for someone whose not a mage or an adc.

>Knockups were specifically designed to counter tenacity

Would u say they are soft or hard cc?

Hard. Definitely. The first two REMOVE movement entirely, the last removes all ability to attack AND slows.

From what I understand, soft CC is anything that limits (but does not remove) the ability to either attack or move. Blind, for example, only affects basic attacks. Hard CC is something that completely blocks the target's ability to either move (root, snare), attack (polymorph), or both (stun).
Roots and polymorphs aren't as lethal as a stun though. A stun is essentially the combination of both of them.

Well yeah. All CC are not created equal, especially for some champs; for example, I'd far rather be blinded than slowed if I'm playing Nami. They're still both considered soft CC though. Same with Root, Polymorph, and Stun; Stun might be literally both combined, but they're all considered "hard CC".

>Make knockups affected by tenacity. It's ridiculous that they are not. 

The way Riot uses knock-ups, it could actually break things if they made that change. To clarify: there is no mechanical difference between a knock-up and a displacement. 

> [{quoted}](name=Ariel the Cruel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cjEOV5Ka,comment-id=0018,timestamp=2017-07-16T18:05:24.679+0000)

> 
> What they should do is replace knock-ups with stuns except where really needed, then remove tenacity except where really needed (no longer purchasable). That will retain roughly the current game state without screwing over champions balanced around tenacity (Irelia). It will also make tenacity a strong kit-worthy addition for ~~Power creep~~ tanks.
Well if you assume tenacity and brittle are both multipliers, it'll technically be more like tenacity counters brittle (just like how slows counter speed ups).

Ok, lets follow that thought.

Quoted is math.

>We'll say Brittle is a 30% extension (matching merc's 30% tenacity).

>On a 1 second stun, that's 0.3 seconds extension or reduction.
If, Like MS modifiers, Brittle applies first:
Ten only: 0.7
1 -> 1.3
1.3 x 0.3 = 0.39
1.3 -> 0.91
Change from base: 0.09
Change from Ten only: +0.21

>Let's look at Morgana's 3 second root instead.
Ten only: 2.1
3 -> 3.9
3.9 x 0.3 = 1.17
3.9 -> 2.73
Change from base: -0.27
Change from Ten only: +0.63

>Now Ashe's full strength ult stun (longest in game): 3.5 seconds.
Ten only: 2.45
3.5 -> 4.55
4.55 x 0.3 = 1.365
4.55 -> 3.185
Change from base: -0.315
Change from Ten only: +0.735

> For reference: Lee Sin has (I think) the shortest immobilization, with a 0.25 second root on his ult. Followed by Leona with a 0.5 second root on Zenith Blade.

---------------------

The change from the longest duration stun in the game when matching brittle *and* tenacity is less than half a second. On a 1 second stun, the change from the default value won't even be noticeable. 
The problem is, CC duration uses such *small* values that multiplicative modifications *effectively* cancel each other out. It works on MS modifiers because they use much larger values.

------------------------

MS example:

>The lowest possible MS a slow can work from is 325 (slow effects don't stack); so we'll use that. Again, 30% buff and 30% slow.

>325 x 0.3 = 97.5
Buff only: 422.5
Slow only: 227.5

>Buff + Slow
422.5 x 0.3 = 126.75
422.5 - 125.75 = 296.75

>Change from base: -28.25
Change from slow only: +69.25

> For reference: {{item:1001}} provides +25 MS.

--------------------------

***EDIT:***
Meddler confirmed, Brittle is a [30% extension](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/uUbIoEB2-new-champ-is-able-to-extand-crowd-controls-duration?comment=00040003).
